title: VolTS: A Volatility-based Trading System to forecast Stock Markets Trend using Statistics and Machine Learning. (arXiv:2307.13422v1 [q-fin.TR])
abstract: Volatility-based trading strategies have attracted a lot of attention in financial markets due to their ability to capture opportunities for profit from market dynamics. In this article, we propose a new volatility-based trading strategy that combines statistical analysis with machine learning techniques to forecast stock markets trend.  The method consists of several steps including, data exploration, correlation and autocorrelation analysis, technical indicator use, application of hypothesis tests and statistical models, and use of variable selection algorithms. In particular, we use the k-means++ clustering algorithm to group the mean volatility of the nine largest stocks in the NYSE and NasdaqGS markets. The resulting clusters are the basis for identifying relationships between stocks based on their volatility behaviour. Next, we use the Granger Causality Test on the clustered dataset with mid-volatility to determine the predictive power of a stock over another stock. By identifyin

translated_title: VolTS：一种利用统计和机器学习预测股市趋势的基于波动性的交易系统
translated_abstract: 基于波动性的交易策略因其能够从市场动态中捕捉利润机会而在金融市场中引起了很大关注。在本文中，我们提出了一种将统计分析与机器学习技术相结合的新型基于波动性的交易策略，用于预测股市趋势。该方法包括数据探索、相关性和自相关性分析、技术指标使用、假设检验和统计模型应用以及变量选择算法的使用等多个步骤。特别地，我们使用k-means++聚类算法对纽约证券交易所和纳斯达克交易所的九个最大股票的平均波动性进行分组。得到的聚类结果是基于股票波动性行为来识别股票之间关系的基础。接下来，我们使用格兰杰因果性检验对中等波动性的聚类数据集进行，以确定一只股票对另一只股票的预测能力。通过识别这些关系，我们构建一个交易系统来预测股市趋势。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新型的基于波动性的交易策略，结合统计分析和机器学习技术，用于预测股市趋势。方法包括多个步骤，如数据探索、相关性分析、技术指标应用、假设检验和变量选择算法。研究使用聚类算法对股票进行分组，并利用格兰杰因果性检验确定股票之间的预测关系。总结来说，这一方法可用于建立一个交易系统，以预测股市趋势。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new volatility-based trading strategy that combines statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to forecast stock market trends. The method involves several steps, including data exploration, correlation analysis, technical indicator application, hypothesis testing, and variable selection algorithms. Researchers use clustering algorithm to group stocks and employ Granger causality test to determine predictive relationships. In summary, this approach can be used to build a trading system for predicting stock market trends.
